message.content: This question requires an understanding of the impact of different actions on the environment. Option (A) suggests the responsible disposal of plastics in special containers, which helps prevent them from ending up in landfills or oceans, where they can harm wildlife and ecosystems. Options (B), (C), and (D) all describe actions that have negative impacts on nature. Burning old used tires releases harmful pollutants into the air, putting cigarettes out in ponds can contaminate the water and harm aquatic life, and using aerosol air fresheners can contribute to air pollution. Therefore, option (A) is the most likely choice for a thing that has a good impact on nature.

This question is about understanding environmentally-friendly actions. Option (A) is the correct answer because putting plastics in special containers, such as recycling bins, helps prevent them from ending up in landfills or polluting natural environments. Options (B) and (C) are harmful to the environment because burning tires releases harmful pollutants and putting cigarettes out in ponds contributes to water pollution. Option (D) is also harmful to the environment because aerosol air fresheners contain chemicals that can contribute to air pollution.

This question requires an understanding of what actions have a positive impact on nature. Option (A) is the correct answer because putting plastics in special containers helps to reduce pollution and promotes recycling. Options (B), (C), and (D) are all harmful to the environment. Burning old used tires releases toxic gases into the air, putting cigarettes out in ponds pollutes the water and can harm aquatic life, and using aerosol air fresheners can contribute to air pollution.

Option (D) is incorrect because aerosol air fresheners often contain harmful chemicals that contribute to air pollution.
